title: Zillow (Z) Receives Media Impact Rating of 0.16
content: News stories about Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) have trended somewhat positive this week, Accern reports. The research firm rates the sentiment of news coverage by analyzing more than twenty million news and blog sources. Accern ranks coverage of publicly-traded companies on a scale of -1 to 1, with scores closest to one being the most favorable. Zillow earned a media sentiment score of 0.16 on Accern’s scale. Accern also assigned media coverage about the financial services provider an impact score of 45.6288828864563 out of 100, meaning that recent news coverage is somewhat unlikely to have an impact on the company’s share price in the near term.    These are some of the media headlines that may have impacted Accern Sentiment Analysis’s scoring:    Get Zillow alerts:     The Political and Policy Conundrum of Rent Control (zillow.com)  Less than 10% of US homes remain underwater, Zillow says (realtybiznews.com)  Spencer M. Rascoff Sells 50,000 Shares of Zillow (Z) Stock (americanbankingnews.com)  What’s it like to be the first agent to sell a home owned by Zillow? (inman.com)  Zillow Has Listed the House From ‘Incredibles 2’ and It Has Some Super Features (wnep.com)   Several equities research analysts have recently commented on the company. ValuEngine upgraded Zillow from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating in a report on Saturday. BidaskClub upgraded Zillow from a “buy” rating to a “strong-buy” rating in a report on Saturday. Bank of America upped their price objective on Zillow to $56.00 and gave the company a “buy” rating in a research note on Tuesday, May 8th. Craig Hallum downgraded Zillow from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating and set a $49.75 price objective for the company. in a research note on Friday, April 13th. Finally, KeyCorp  set a $63.00 price objective on Zillow and gave the company a “buy” rating in a research note on Thursday, April 12th. Five investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, six have issued  a buy rating and one  has given a strong buy rating to the stock. The stock currently has a consensus rating of “Buy” and an average price target of $55.58.      Zillow traded up $0.70, hitting $59.03, on Friday, according to MarketBeat Ratings . 1,677,685 shares of the company were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 1,820,496. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.14, a quick ratio of 7.64 and a current ratio of 7.64. Zillow has a 12 month low of $37.68 and a 12 month high of $59.99.    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) last released its quarterly earnings data on Monday, May 7th. The financial services provider reported ($0.09) earnings per share for the quarter. Zillow had a negative return on equity of 0.40% and a negative net margin of 9.59%. The business had revenue of $299.88 million during the quarter.    In other Zillow news, CEO Spencer M. Rascoff sold 50,000 shares of Zillow stock in a transaction on Wednesday, May 30th. The stock was sold at an average price of $57.30, for a total value of $2,865,000.00. Following the completion of the sale, the chief executive officer now owns 50,000 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $2,865,000. The transaction was disclosed in a filing with the SEC, which can be accessed through the SEC website . Also, Vice Chairman Lloyd D. Frink sold 13,600 shares of Zillow stock in a transaction on Wednesday, March 21st. The stock was sold at an average price of $57.42, for a total value of $780,912.00. Following the completion of the sale, the insider now directly owns 4,279,608 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $245,735,091.36. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . In the last 90 days, insiders sold 1,355,911 shares of company stock valued at $73,265,038. 21.72% of the stock is currently owned by company insiders.    Zillow Company Profile    Zillow Group, Inc operates real estate and home-related information marketplaces on mobile and the Web in the United States. The company offers a portfolio of brands and products to enable consumers find information about homes and connect with local professionals. Its brands focus on various stages of the home lifecycle, including renting, buying, selling, and financing.
